heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 3 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.6.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (214°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.4 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 77.6m higher than yesterday, 11.1m lower than the past week, 23.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 557m minimum and 849m maximum, with an average of 749.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 760.2m and 773.0m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
